segments.text: So Chris , I've heard that you're from a big family . How many people ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Nine total . Seven children and my parents .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Seven children ? That's a lot . Why did your parents have so many ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , my mother came from a big family , and wanted to have one of her own . My father was an only child , and didn't really care about having a large family , but my mother talked him into it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Jeez , seven children . That must have a lot of problems . We have four children in my family and my grandparents can never get our names right .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: It can be hard , and there are certain sacrifices you have to make .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Like what ? I assume that there's no privacy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That's one . Another is the lack of personal property . Everything you have , from toys to clothes , is used by your brothers and sisters . Especially clothes . Three quarters of my wardrobe are hand-me-downs .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And the age gap is also annoying . There's a ten-year difference between my younger brother and me . We have nothing in common .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Same problem here . There's an 18 - year gap between the oldest and youngest child in my family . The last child was born just as the oldest was going to college .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , at least going to college won't be too bad . Since both of your parents are college professors , they must give you reduced tuition at the college .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They do , but it doesn't help too much . Having seven children means that the money situation in my home is always pretty tight .
segments.speaker: S2
